author: Staff Reporter
text:
The tableaux of the Puducherry Police Department depicting anti-terror operations and launch of CCTNS Citizen portal service in the R- Day parade on Tuesday.— Photo: T. Singaravelou

At least 14 departments including the Police, Tourism, Women and Child Development, Adi-Dravidar Welfare, Agriculture, PASIC and KVK tableaux highlighted various issues. The Police Department that won the first place in tableaux highlighted the ills of drunken driving, services available to report on theft and anti-terrorism operation.

St. Joseph of Cluny Girls’ Higher Secondary School and Subramania Bharathiar Government Girls’ Higher Secondary School won the first place for March-past in the private and government girls school categories respectively.

The 67{+t}{+h}Republic Day was observed in Pondicherry University, Jipmer and also the office of the Commissioner of Central Excise & Service Tax.

Vice-Chancellor (i/c) of Pondicherry University Prof. Anisa Basheer Khan hoisted the National Flag at the facade of the Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Administrative Building on Tuesday.

At Jipmer

At Jipmer, students, staff and the faculty participated in the celebrations where Jipmer director Dr. Subhash Chandra Parija hoisted the National Flag.

He stressed that Jipmer family should ensure that the common man who comes for treatment is satisfied with the services that the institution provides.

During his speech, he stressed students to volunteer in community programmes and in helping the poor and the underprivileged.

In the office of the Commissioner of Central Excise & Service Tax, Goubert Avenue, Puducherry, IRS Commissioner U. Niranjan inspected the Guard of Honour and hoisted the National Flag.
title: Police dept. bags first place for tableaux
